name: Pulled Jackfruit Sandwiches
description: Jackfruit is the plant kingdom’s answer to pulled pork or chicken, with a meaty texture that’s ideal for soaking up all those smoky, spicy and saucy flavours we’re about to throw its way. They’re great for meat eaters and veg heads alike. But it’s a bit spicy; use a little less seasoning, if you prefer it mild.

ingredients.name: Pulled Pork Seasoning or Chicken Barbacoa Seasoning

preparation: In Collapsible Strainer, drain and rinse jackfruit.
In Sauté Pan, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add jackfruit. Using Sauté Spoon, stir occasionally until slightly softened, about 4 min.
Add seasoning, ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, and water to pan. Stir to combine.
Cover and simmer on low 7 min, stirring occasionally. Jackfruit should be soft enough to break apart.
Remove from heat; using Sauté Spoon, mash jackfruit. It will shred and resemble pulled chicken.
tips: Find canned jackfruit in the canned fruit aisle of the grocery store. Make sure to purchase in brine (not syrup!).

Jackfruit is a popular, plant-based alternative to making pulled chicken or pork! Make sure to serve this alongside a protein of choice; while delicious, jackfruit is not a significant source of protein.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup coleslaw (try it in the sandwich!) and 1 cup lean protein of choice, such as baked beans or egg salad.

products.name: Pulled Pork Seasoning (Pack of 3)
summary: This seasoning is a shortcut to the south when you’re in the mood for some BBQ! Grab a slow cooker and let the pork slowly infuse with notes of deep, sweet ‘n tangy barbecue and a hint of smokiness. So good!

products.name: Sauté Pan
summary: An all-purpose pan to brown, sauté, and simmer—ideal for one pan meals.

products.name: Sauté Spoon
summary: Stir it up! The ultimate kitchen tool for stirring, sautéing, and serving, this sturdy spoon will soon replace all the other ones taking up space in your drawers. Built with a flat head, it’s great for scraping bowls and easy to store.
